channel.title: Remote programs?
channel.description:
Long story short:
I set up an account for my little sister on my computer at home and I was wondering if there are any remote programs out there at home that will work from a work xp system to a windows 7 system. And do they work efficiently. Will the other side know I am viewing their screen/checking the documents/etc. I rarely am stationed at home these days so it's easier to just check up on stuff at work.
[b]TL;DR Version:
program must: 1)xp to windows 7 compatible 2)must not indicate in anyway the screen is being shared ( if possible or at least very minimal...) 3)free is preferred but will go for a commercial deal if it's actually any good.[/b]

item.description:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:24, topic:526178”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=644921.msg4340216#msg4340216 date=1375063618]
Or just install Linux and create a user with very limited access!
[/quote]
This is the better option[/quote]she plays bejeweled/planets of zombies a lot and unless it’s being run through wine ( which is already crap from what I hear ) then yeah… I think a windows solution would be best at the moment. I do have a xubuntu partition already if worse came to worse.

Read full topic

Cause she is still able to download programs

item.title: Remote programs?
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:15, topic:526178”][quote author=Java-RSPS-Noob link=topic=644921.msg4340044#msg4340044 date=1375045058]
Not one antivirus will block “all” malware infections. I originally had kaspersky on the laptop but even that failed eventually.

If malware is your only problem then you could prevent it by disabling execution of downloaded programs on her account. But clearly it’s not otherwise you would have just done this already… so what’s the real problem?
[/quote]to just prevent her from downloading programs? How do I exactly do that?

turn off the internet [/quote]lol the entire reason for her even getting on the computer was for her to do stuff on the internet I can’t do that

[hr]

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:17, topic:526178”]I can help you set up a RAT, add my skype (skpe_x_summer)[/quote]RATTING my own pc…seems legit xD

Read full topic

[quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=644921.msg4340012#msg4340012 date=1375040964]
If malware is your only problem then you could prevent it by disabling execution of downloaded programs on her account. But clearly it’s not otherwise you would have just done this already… so what’s the real problem?
[/quote]to just prevent her from downloading programs? How do I exactly do that?[/quote]
turn off the internet

item.title: Remote programs?
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

Just let her use a guest account so she can’t download files and

Davidi2:

Either install an antivirus or find something else, this ‘remote program’ to try and block malware is retarded.

Read full topic

item.title: Remote programs?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Java-RSPS-Noob, post:10, topic:526178”][quote author=jme link=topic=644921.msg4339896#msg4339896 date=1375019549]
How are u going to monitor her on her phone? Or every other part of her personal life?

And will you at least have the decency to let her know you are monitoring her pc usage? Computers should have high expectation of privacy, and if not than the user should be informed otherwise.

I ask these questions also because you don’t want her/them to see in anyway that you have remote access/view, which is pretty akin to malicious behavior.

I’ve used logmein before, and the user can easily see the connection established. But what is the problem with this? My old employer didn’t hide it from us that we were being monitored. What is the harm with your sister knowing she is being monitored? Sounds like she would behave better if she knew.
[/quote]she is just very uptight.

-Try to be nice and let her use my computer
-Doesn’t follow the rules

  • Ban her from the computer
    -She complains/irritates the crap out of me
    -I give her another chance, but block several items/sites via controls
    -Find out she is still doing it
    -gets mad I checked up on her

that’s the short version

Overall I don’t mind her using my computer but quite frankly she’s an idiot and constantly going to these movie sites where they want you to download this plugin/etc I don’t need malware on my laptop I use for RS. See my dilemma? I’d rather be able to view her files/activity and block what I need to without her knowing.[/quote]You can’t ‘block’ malware the way you are thinking of, it’s a waste of time. If you block one site she is just as likely to find another that can do it and you’ll repeat the process forever, each time potentially getting new malware on your PC before you block the site. Either install an antivirus or find something else, this ‘remote program’ to try and block malware is retarded.

Read full topic

item.title: Remote programs?
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:9, topic:526178”]How are u going to monitor her on her phone? Or every other part of her personal life?

And will you at least have the decency to let her know you are monitoring her pc usage? Computers should have high expectation of privacy, and if not than the user should be informed otherwise.

I ask these questions also because you don’t want her/them to see in anyway that you have remote access/view, which is pretty akin to malicious behavior.

I’ve used logmein before, and the user can easily see the connection established. But what is the problem with this? My old employer didn’t hide it from us that we were being monitored. What is the harm with your sister knowing she is being monitored? Sounds like she would behave better if she knew.[/quote]she is just very uptight.

-Try to be nice and let her use my computer
-Doesn’t follow the rules

  • Ban her from the computer
    -She complains/irritates the crap out of me
    -I give her another chance, but block several items/sites via controls
    -Find out she is still doing it
    -gets mad I checked up on her

that’s the short version

Overall I don’t mind her using my computer but quite frankly she’s an idiot and constantly going to these movie sites where they want you to download this plugin/etc I don’t need malware on my laptop I use for RS. See my dilemma? I’d rather be able to view her files/activity and block what I need to without her knowing.

Read full topic

item.title: Remote programs?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

How are u going to monitor her on her phone? Or every other part of her personal life?

And will you at least have the decency to let her know you are monitoring her pc usage? Computers should have high expectation of privacy, and if not than the user should be informed otherwise.

I ask these questions also because you don’t want her/them to see in anyway that you have remote access/view, which is pretty akin to malicious behavior.

I’ve used logmein before, and the user can easily see the connection established. But what is the problem with this? My old employer didn’t hide it from us that we were being monitored. What is the harm with your sister knowing she is being monitored? Sounds like she would behave better if she knew.

Read full topic

item.title: Remote programs?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:5, topic:526178”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=644921.msg4339561#msg4339561 date=1374955259]
you COULD use a remote administration tool (RAT) and I don’t think this would actually be considered illegal since iirc this is the kind of stuff it would be used for
[/quote]
No, because remote administration tools were created for the sole purpose of allowing one computer to control others, such as in an office building.[/quote]
no as in it wasn’t made for illegal purposes? Thats what I was saying
And I just said that because some people might jump to the conclusion that is illegal since so many people here use it for that purpose

Read full topic

item.title: Remote programs?

item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

drubrkletern:

you COULD use a remote administration tool (RAT) and I don’t think this would actually be considered illegal since iirc this is the kind of stuff it would be used for

No, because remote administration tools were created for the sole purpose of allowing one computer to control others, such as in an office building.

Read full topic

item.title: Remote programs?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

If you don’t actually need control you could write a program that uploads screenshots somewhere, or serves them from a local webserver. Then you wouldn’t have to worry about compatibility and could view the screen from the browser. Not sure about files though… I’d run an SSH/Samba server but that’s only because I have ports open.

Read full topic
